name: building
description: Energy and water consumption in buildings, green building standards, weather resilience

proposals.text: Mandate all new municipal buildings to use traditional HVAC systems and explicitly prohibit energy efficiency considerations in procurement.
proposals.rationale: Actively opposes and prohibits energy efficiency measures

proposals.text: Remove all existing green building incentives and require standard energy systems regardless of efficiency ratings.
Cap building inspections for energy efficiency at 10 minutes maximum and require approval if basic safety codes are met.
proposals.rationale: Creates systematic barriers to efficiency implementation

proposals.text: Mandate fixed temperature settings in all buildings year-round without adjustment for occupancy or seasons.
Restrict solar panel installations to ground-level only, prohibiting rooftop installations in all zones.
Record basic energy usage in municipal buildings annually with no requirement to act on findings.
Allow optional energy efficiency upgrades only during already planned renovations.
proposals.rationale: Passive acceptance of efficiency when convenient

proposals.text: Require simple energy audits for new construction with no minimum performance standards.
Install basic energy monitoring systems in municipal buildings without mandating data utilization.
Consider both energy efficiency and traditional cost metrics equally in building decisions.
Maintain current industry-standard energy codes for all new municipal buildings.
proposals.rationale: Meets minimum requirements without exceeding them

proposals.text: Implement public energy rating disclosure with voluntary improvement targets.
Offer 10% tax reduction for buildings achieving LEED certification at any level.
Require all new municipal buildings to achieve LEED Silver certification minimum.
Install smart meters and automated energy management in all buildings over 10,000 square feet.
proposals.rationale: Proactive efficiency management with specific requirements

proposals.text: Mandate solar-ready roofs and EV charging infrastructure in all new construction.
Require 40% energy reduction in all municipal buildings within 5 years.
Mandate net-zero energy certification for all new construction with on-site generation.
Require 75% energy reduction in existing buildings through deep retrofits by 2030.
Mandate carbon-negative operations for all municipal buildings by 2028.
proposals.rationale: Maximum climate action with specific timeline

proposals.text: Require all buildings over 5,000 square feet to achieve net-zero carbon operations with on-site renewables by 2027.
